issue.title: [CF 294] TellMeWhen4.46
issue.body:
首先感谢作者能给我们带来这么好用的插件
在这里 ，我有一个问题，希望能得到你的帮助
我在中国游戏 游戏版本为4.1 目前能用TellMeWhen4.46 然而4.46中没有符文冷却系统。下载了TellMeWhen4.5 中国游戏版本不能支持。
因而 想你能帮我在TellMeWhen4.46 中加入符文冷却系统 或者是将TellMeWhen4.5 修改成中国的游戏版本可用


> Posted by CurseForge user ilovelbh | Imported from CurseForge issue #294 | Raw

comments.body:
Alright, I need your help with this one, lsjyzjl.

From what I could tell from the OP on WoWInterface (http://www.wowinterface.com/downloads/fileinfo.php?id=10855#comments), and by running this ticket through Google translate, there is an issue with the rune cooldown icon type breaking TMW functionality on clients running WoW 4.1. I can't imagine why, as DKs have existed since 3.0 (as has the rune API), and when I delete the rune API, there are no errors that occur. It may be some other issue that is occuring.

Could you respond and ask if there were any Lua errors that occured (or if he/she has Lua errors enabled)?

Hopefully some non-Google translation will help clear things up.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

At first he said thanks for all your hard work to make a useful addon.

His question :
Beacuse version of WOW in China is still 4.1, not 4.2, if TellMeWhen version bigger than 4.4.6 will stuck on loading screen, so he hope you can make a "Standalone" version (such as 4.4.7) with the rune icon for WOW player in china or tell him how to add the rune icon into version 4.4.6, or make the last version to compatible with WOW 4.1, I told him it's hard to implement for compatible with WOW 4.1, beacuse we don't have 4.1 client to test.

Edited Sep 19, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

@ilovelbh:
關於你提到的這個問題,因為除了中國大陸之外都已經更新到4.2版本,無法在4.1的環境下測試,所以不可能在新版本中實現對4.1的兼容.
另外,我已經跟作者反應了,讓他考慮看看是不是可以提供一個"特殊且獨立"的4.4.6版本,或者是不是可以提供在4.4.6版本添加你所需功能的方法,當然這要看他本人的意願.


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

I can't begin to imagine what the problem could be. The only thing that crossed my mind was outdated SpellIDs (in equivs, my lovely hardcoding, or from Lib DRData-1.0), but there are checks in place for most things to ensure that invalid spellIDs aren't causing errors in most areas of the code.

Edited Sep 19, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

YAY IDLE MUSINGS! It turns out that the problem really is an invalid spellID. While my checks are catching the invalid spellID, they aren't actually doing anything about it other than reporting it to the user, so there is infinite recursion as it tries over and over again to process the invalid ID.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Going to mark this as fixed, as I am 99.999% sure that that was the problem. Also releasing 4.5.6 to Curse and WoWI

Edited Sep 19, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
